content.description: Climb the stemming start through soft rock through a bulge into better stone. Stem your way out the slightly overhanging dihederal up top to a ledge and reach out to the anchors on the left.
content.location: A few minutes beyond the Flame and Gory area, but a few minutes before Ombudsman.

content.description: An enjoyable, wide, right facing dihederal with a crux move exiting the dihedral up top.
content.protection: Gear to #6 Camalot. Two bolts for the anchor, but only one bolt-hanger. Traverse the ledge to rap off the anchors of the 10c mixed line to the right.
content.location: About 10-15minute hike beyond (climber's right) Flame and Gory. Just left of a mixed, 5.10c.

content.description: Fun climbing on interesting terrain and decent rock. This varied crack pulls a 5.9 bulge, followed by a flaring 5.10 roof, followed by slightly runout 5.7 terrain on lichen covered holds.
content.protection: Gear to 4inches. Extra hand sized pieces. Anchor is a large tree 20 ft back from the edge.
content.location: This route is a few minutes climber's right of the Squeal Like a Pig boulder.

content.description: This route climbs a slabby, right facing dihederal finger crack in a large alcove just uphill from the Squeal Like a Pig boulder.
content.protection: Mostly small to hand sized stuff. Anchor is a ratty sling around the top of the block. Build a belay to top rope.
content.location: In the large alcove uphill from the Squeal Like a Pig boulder.

content.description:
In a unique alcove, capped with a giant roof, framed by two large pine trees and protected by a small boulder, the view from anywhere on this route is welcoming. Jam the crack and pull on sandy jugs through the slightly overhanging start to a rest in a triangular alcove. Lie back and/or jam the wide (4") crack to reach the bolted anchors just below the roof.  

  Alternate second pitch traverses right under the roof along the blank slab, then up through the notch to the top. 5.10d.
content.protection: Hand sized to 2 #4s. Bolted Anchors with sling, quick-link, and carabiner.
content.location: In the small alcove on the wall opposite the slowly forming Natural Bridge.

content.description: This is the first obvious route at Deliverance. A wide 3-4" crack splits a right facing dihederal. The top crawls through heinous, steep, leaf-covered-mud to a good belay tree.
content.location: 4th class walk off a few hundred feet climber's right.

content.description: A very impressive, continuous crack interrupted by a large ledge. This is the areas namesake route. Â First pitch goes at 5.10c while the second has a short 5.11a crux towards the end after moderate climbing.
content.protection: Rack to a #4 with doubles from #2 up with trees for anchors
content.location: Shortly before the bluff line takes a turn south at the 4th class scramble, there is a tall, prominent crack that starts in a dihedral with a large ledge at about 55 feet.

content.description: Climb the wide-crack start, or boulder up small, crimpy pockets to a good stance and your first piece. Follow the crack up till it dissipates, traverse left to another crack, and top out on the ledge to the left.
content.protection: Standard rack. Bolt anchors on ledge out left.
content.location: On the sunny wall to the right of the Flame and Gory alcove, just left of a cool, shallow, low roof.

content.description:
Deliverance can be seen when looking Southeast from Sam's Throne. The Giant boulder just below the cliff line is Squeal Like a Pig boulder. The first few routes face North (thus they remain wet for long periods) but the cliff band turns at the Squeal Like a Pig boulder to face more south.  

  Since it's a long bushwhack, and mostly trad lines, Deliverance is rarely visited.
